statement.p: A cheesecake recipe calls for 150 g of eggs and 750 g of cream cheese. If you currently have 200 g of eggs and 1739 g of cream cheese, determine which ingredient is the limiting one (will use all of it) and the amount of each you will use.

solution.p: To determine which ingredient limits us, we compare the ratios \displaystyle\frac{{200}}{{1739}}={0.11500862564692} to the recipe's ratio of \displaystyle\frac{{1}}{{5}}={0.2}. Because the ratio is less than 0.2, we know that the eggs is the limiting ingredient.
Solving gives us 8695 g of cream cheese
